question: Which national park is also known as "Valia Calda"?
explanation: Pindus National Park, also known as Valia Calda (meaning the Warm Valley in Aromanian), is a national park in mainland Greece, situated in an isolated mountainous area at the periphery of West Macedonia and Epirus, in the northeastern part of the Pindus mountain range. It belongs to the Natura 2000 ecological network of protected areas and is one of the three places in Greece that hosts a population of brown bears.
